intro: Gonzalea bracteosa, commonly known as the bracted gonzalea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically alternate, with a rough texture and a pale green color. Gonzalea bracteosa is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
